summary: A historical marker in Menomonie, Wisconsin, commemorating a bell from the Stout Manual Training School. The bell was installed in 1897 and stopped working in 1914. It was replaced with a carillon in 1997 and a monument was built for the original bell in 1999.
scene: A scene of historical education and preservation in Menomonie, Wisconsin
reasoning: The document discusses the historical bell and its associated marker and monument located in Menomonie, Wisconsin. The text also mentions the time period from 1891 to 1999, which supports the estimated time period.
